title: Approaches to estimating probability
body:
A district is evaluating the probability that a new math curriculum will increase Algebra I pass rates. Three different estimates are produced:
$$1$$. A panel of instructional coaches predicts outcomes based on prior experience.
$$2$$. Researchers analyze pilot test results from six implementation schools.
$$3$$. A statistician models expected outcomes assuming equal instructional effectiveness across classrooms.
District leaders want to classify each estimation method before deciding which evidence to prioritize.
courseName: EEPL614 Quantitative Methods for Educational Leadership
